N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 416.10 - Child abuse and maltreatment

State Regulations
(a) Any abuse or maltreatment of a child
receiving child care or residing in the home, including the provider's children
and any foster children, is prohibited. A group family day care home must
prohibit and may not tolerate or in any manner condone an act of abuse or
maltreatment by an employee, volunteer or any other person. An
abused
child
or
maltreated child
means a child defined as an
abused child or maltreated child pursuant to section
412
of the

Social Services Law. (b) In
accordance with the provisions of sections
413
and
415
of the

Social Services Law, caregivers must immediately report any suspected incidents
of child abuse or maltreatment concerning a child receiving child care to the

Statewide Central Register of Child Abuse and Maltreatment or cause such a
report to be made when the caregiver has reasonable cause to suspect that a
child coming before them in their capacity as caregiver in a group family day
care is an abused or maltreated child. Such report must be followed by a
written report within 48 hours, in the form and manner prescribed by the
office, to the child protective service of the social services district in the
county in which the child resides. Notes
